alert.note: Alert for Clay; Lowndes; Noxubee; Oktibbeha; Webster; Winston (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 11:30AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN NOXUBEE... OKTIBBEHA...NORTHEASTERN WINSTON...EAST CENTRAL WEBSTER...CLAY AND LOWNDES COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 PM CST... At 1130 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Cumberland to near Longview to near Betheden. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Starkville, Longview, Pheba, and Craig Springs around 1135 AM CST. Griffith and Oktoc around 1140 AM CST. Muldrow, Sessums, and Pala Alto around 1145 AM CST. West Point, Artesia, and Tibbee around 1150 AM CST. Waverly and Bent Oak around 1200 PM CST. Columbus and Columbus AFB around 1205 PM CST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Lowndes; Noxubee; Oktibbeha; Webster; Winston
